result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Torriano Mire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
*6/24/2016 Court found that further review is not needed.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
**6/24/2016  amended to reflect Court waived nonmandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.  Defendant only to pay the DNA and DV surcharges.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review on 2/26/16.
**02-26-16/PRH**
Defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to spend 3 days in HOC; STRAIGHT TIME, with No Good Time Credit. Court ordered 2 more days condition time if receipt not provided.
*03/25/16/Honorable Janet Protasiewicz.  Defendant is noncompliance with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 2 days. Straight time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in HOC.
**6/24/2016   Remaining condition time is STAYED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Torriano Mire

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court amended JOC to reflect court WAIVED non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Defendant to only pay the DNA and DV surcharges. Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court held colloquy with defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 2 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation. Court admonished defendant. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (3 days straight time). Court ordered 2 more days condition time if receipt not provided to agent. Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers has agreed to hear this case for Judge Dallet, who is in trial.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case adjourned back to Branch 40 for sentencing.
Jury trial date of 10/21/2015 is vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Defendant does qualify for a public defender but one has not been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation - per today's report from the Public Defender.
Statements to the Court.  Defendant may now qualify for representation.  Court instructs defendant to get the necessary documentation and contact the Public Defender's office prior to the next court date.  Defendant is advised that all bail conditions remain as previously set, including the No Contact Order.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.A.S. dob 11/05/1981.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Matthew Torriano Mire in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
